modules.name: along
modules.description: Takes a line and returns a point at a specified distance along the line.

returns.desc: Point  distance   units  along the line

params.Description: can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

modules.name: area
modules.description: Takes one or more features and returns their area in square meters.

modules.name: bboxClip
modules.description: Takes a Feature and a bbox and clips the feature to the bbox using lineclip. May result in degenerate edges when clipping Polygons.

params.Description: feature to clip to the bbox
extent in  minX, minY, maxX, maxY  order

modules.name: bboxPolygon
modules.description: Takes a bbox and returns an equivalent polygon.

returns.desc: a Polygon representation of the bounding box

params.Description: extent in  minX, minY, maxX, maxY  order

modules.name: bbox
modules.description: Takes a set of features, calculates the bbox of all input features, and returns a bounding box.

returns.desc: bbox extent in  minX, minY, maxX, maxY  order

modules.name: bearing
modules.description: Takes two points and finds the geographic bearing between them, i.e. the angle measured in degrees from the north line (0 degrees)

returns.desc: bearing in decimal degrees, between -180 and 180 degrees (positive clockwise)

params.Description: calculates the final bearing if true

modules.name: bezier
modules.description: Takes a line and returns a curved version by applying a Bezier spline algorithm.

params.Description: a measure of how curvy the path should be between splines

modules.name: booleanClockwise
modules.description: Takes a ring and return true or false whether or not the ring is clockwise or counter-clockwise.

modules.name: booleanCrosses
modules.description:
Boolean-Crosses returns True if the intersection results in a geometry whose dimension is one less than
the maximum dimension of the two source geometries and the intersection set is interior to
both source geometries.

modules.name: booleanContains
modules.description:
Boolean-contains returns True if the second geometry is completely contained by the first geometry.
The interiors of both geometries must intersect and, the interior and boundary of the secondary (geometry b)
must not intersect the exterior of the primary (geometry a).
Boolean-contains returns the exact opposite result of the  @turf/boolean-within.

modules.name: booleanDisjoint
modules.description: Boolean-disjoint returns (TRUE) if the intersection of the two geometries is an empty set.

modules.name: booleanOverlap
modules.description:
Compares two geometries of the same dimension and returns true if their intersection set results in a geometry
different from both but of the same dimension. It applies to Polygon/Polygon, LineString/LineString,
Multipoint/Multipoint, MultiLineString/MultiLineString and MultiPolygon/MultiPolygon.

modules.name: booleanPointOnLine
modules.description: Returns true if a point is on a line. Accepts a optional parameter to ignore the start and end vertices of the linestring.

params.Description: whether to ignore the start and end vertices.

modules.name: buffer
modules.description: Calculates a buffer for input features for a given radius. Units supported are miles, kilometers, and degrees.

params.Description: distance to draw the buffer (negative values are allowed)
any of the options supported by turf units

modules.name: centerOfMass
modules.description: Takes any Feature or a FeatureCollection and returns its center of mass using this formula: Centroid of Polygon.

params.Description: an Object that is used as the  Feature 's properties

modules.name: center
modules.description: Takes a Feature or FeatureCollection and returns the absolute center point of all features.

returns.desc: a Point feature at the absolute center point of all input features

params.Description: an Object that is used as the  Feature 's properties

modules.name: centroid
modules.description:
Takes one or more features and calculates the centroid using the mean of all vertices.
This lessens the effect of small islands and artifacts when calculating the centroid of a set of polygons.

returns.desc: the centroid of the input features

params.Description: an Object that is used as the  Feature 's properties

modules.name: circle
modules.description: Takes a Point and calculates the circle polygon given a radius in degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers; and steps for precision.

modules.name: clone
modules.description:
Returns a cloned copy of the passed GeoJSON Object.
By default it duplicates only the standard GeoJSON fields of the object; if  cloneAll  is set to  true  all
fields of the Object, thus including 'Foreign Members', will be cloned (3-20x slower).
modules.snippet:
var line = turf.lineString([[-74, 40], [-78, 42], [-82, 35]]);

var lineCloned = turf.clone(line);
modules.example:
var line = turf.lineString([[-74, 40], [-78, 42], [-82, 35]]);

var lineCloned = turf.clone(line);

params.Description: clones entire GeoJSON object, using JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(geojson))

modules.name: clustersDbscan
modules.description: Takes a set of points and partition them into clusters according to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DBSCAN data clustering algorithm.

returns.desc: Clustered Points with an additional two properties associated to each Feature:

params.Description: Maximum Distance between any point of the cluster to generate the clusters (kilometers only)
in which  maxDistance  is expressed, can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

Minimum number of points to generate a single cluster,
points which do not meet this requirement will be classified as an 'edge' or 'noise'.

modules.name: clustersKmeans
modules.description: Takes a set of points and partition them into clusters using the k-mean. It uses the k-means algorithm

returns.desc: Clustered Points with an additional two properties associated to each Feature:

params.Description: allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)

modules.name: getCluster
modules.description: Get Cluster

returns.desc: Single Cluster filtered by GeoJSON Properties

params.Description: Filter used on GeoJSON properties to get Cluster

modules.name: collect
modules.description:
Merges a specified property from a FeatureCollection of points into a
FeatureCollection of polygons. Given an  inProperty  on points and an  outProperty 
for polygons, this finds every point that lies within each polygon, collects the
 inProperty  values from those points, and adds them as an array to  outProperty 
on the polygon.

returns.desc: polygons with properties listed based on  outField

params.Description: polygons with values on which to aggregate

modules.name: combine
modules.description: Combines a FeatureCollection of Point , LineString , or Polygon features into MultiPoint , MultiLineString , or MultiPolygon features.

returns.desc: a FeatureCollection of corresponding type to input

modules.name: concave
modules.description: Takes a set of points and returns a concave hull polygon. Internally, this uses turf-tin to generate geometries.

params.Description: the size of an edge necessary for part of the hull to become concave (in miles)
can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

throws.desc: if maxEdge parameter is missing or unable to compute hull

modules.name: convex
modules.description: Takes a Feature or a FeatureCollection and returns a convex hull Polygon.

modules.name: destination
modules.description: Takes a Point and calculates the location of a destination point given a distance in degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers; and bearing in degrees. This uses the Haversine formula to account for global curvature.

modules.name: difference
modules.description: Finds the difference between two polygons by clipping the second polygon from the first.

returns.desc: a Polygon or MultiPolygon feature showing the area of  polygon1  excluding the area of  polygon2  (if empty returns  undefined )

params.Description: Polygon feature to difference from polygon1

modules.name: dissolve
modules.description: Dissolves a FeatureCollection of polygons based on a property. Note that multipart features within the collection are not supported

returns.desc: a FeatureCollection containing the dissolved polygons

params.Description: input feature collection to be dissolved
property name on which to dissolve features

modules.name: distance
modules.description: Calculates the distance between two points in degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers. This uses the Haversine formula to account for global curvature.

params.Description: can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

modules.name: envelope
modules.description: Takes any number of features and returns a rectangular Polygon that encompasses all vertices.

returns.desc: a rectangular Polygon feature that encompasses all vertices

modules.name: explode
modules.description: Takes a feature or set of features and returns all positions as points.

returns.desc: points representing the exploded input features

throws.desc: if it encounters an unknown geometry type

modules.name: flatten
modules.description: Flattens any GeoJSON to a FeatureCollection inspired by geojson-flatten.

returns.desc: all Multi-Geometries are flattened into single Features

modules.name: flip
modules.description: Takes input features and flips all of their coordinates from  [x, y]  to  [y, x].

returns.desc: a feature or set of features of the same type as  input  with flipped coordinates

params.Description: allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)

modules.name: greatCircle
modules.description: Calculate great circles routes as LineString

params.Description:
offset controls the likelyhood that lines will
be split which cross the dateline. The higher the number the more likely.

modules.name: feature
modules.description: Wraps a GeoJSON Geometry in a GeoJSON Feature.

modules.name: hexGrid
modules.description: Takes a bounding box and the diameter of the cell and returns a FeatureCollection of flat-topped hexagons or triangles ( Polygon features) aligned in an "odd-q" vertical grid as described in Hexagonal Grids.

params.Description: extent in  minX, minY, maxX, maxY  order
diameter of the circumcircle of the hexagons, in specified units
used in calculating cell size, can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers
whether to return as triangles instead of hexagons

modules.name: idw
modules.description:
Takes a FeatureCollection of points with known value, a power parameter, a cell depth, a unit of measurement
and returns a FeatureCollection of polygons in a square-grid with an interpolated value property "IDW" for each grid cell.
It finds application when in need of creating a continuous surface (i.e. rainfall, temperature, chemical dispersion surface...)
from a set of spatially scattered points.

returns.desc: grid A grid of polygons with a property field named as  valueField

params.Description: GeoJSON field containing the known value to interpolate on
used in calculating cellSize, can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

modules.name: inside
modules.description: Takes a Point and a Polygon or MultiPolygon and determines if the point resides inside the polygon. The polygon can be convex or concave. The function accounts for holes.

returns.desc: true  if the Point is inside the Polygon;  false  if the Point is not inside the Polygon

params.Description: True if polygon boundary should be ignored when determining if the point is inside the polygon otherwise false.

modules.name: interpolate
modules.description: Takes a set of points and estimates their 'property' values on a grid using the Inverse Distance Weighting (IDW) method.

returns.desc: grid of points or polygons with interpolated 'property'

params.Description: the distance across each grid point
defines the output format based on a Grid Type (options: 'square' | 'point' | 'hex' | 'triangle')
the property name in  points  from which z-values will be pulled, zValue fallbacks to 3rd coordinate if no property exists.
used in calculating cellSize, can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

modules.name: intersect
modules.description: Takes two polygons and finds their intersection. If they share a border, returns the border; if they don't intersect, returns undefined.

returns.desc: returns a feature representing the point(s) they share (in case of a  Point   or  MultiPoint ), the borders they share (in case of a  LineString  or a  MultiLineString ), the area they share (in case of  Polygon  or  MultiPolygon ). If they do not share any point, returns  undefined.

modules.name: getCoord
modules.description: Unwrap a coordinate from a Point Feature, Geometry or a single coordinate.

modules.name: isobands
modules.description: Takes a grid FeatureCollection of Point features with z-values and an array of value breaks and generates filled contour isobands.

returns.desc: a FeatureCollection of  MultiPolygon  features representing isobands

params.Description: the property name in  points  from which z-values will be pulled

modules.name: isolines
modules.description: Takes a grid FeatureCollection of Point features with z-values and an array of value breaks and generates isolines.

returns.desc: a FeatureCollection of  MultiLineString  features representing isolines

params.Description: values of  zProperty  where to draw isolines
the property name in  points  from which z-values will be pulled
GeoJSON properties passed to ALL isolines

GeoJSON properties passed, in order, to the correspondent isoline;
the breaks array will define the order in which the isolines are created

modules.name: kinks
modules.description: Takes a linestring , multi-linestring , multi-polygon , or polygon and returns points at all self-intersections.

modules.name: lineArc
modules.description:
Creates a circular arc, of a circle of the given radius and center point, between bearing1 and bearing2;
0 bearing is North of center point, positive clockwise.

params.Description: angle, in decimal degrees, of the first radius of the arc
angle, in decimal degrees, of the second radius of the arc

modules.name: lineDistance
modules.description: Takes a GeoJSON and measures its length in the specified units, Point 's distance are ignored.

params.Description: can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

modules.name: lineChunk
modules.description: Divides a LineString into chunks of a specified length. If the line is shorter than the segment length then the original line is returned.

params.Description: how long to make each segment
units can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers
reverses coordinates to start the first chunked segment at the end

modules.name: lineIntersect
modules.description: Takes any LineString or Polygon GeoJSON and returns the intersecting point(s).

modules.name: lineOffset
modules.description: Takes a line and returns a line at offset by the specified distance.

returns.desc: Line offset from the input line

params.Description: distance to offset the line (can be of negative value)
can be degrees, radians, miles, kilometers, inches, yards, meters

modules.name: lineOverlap
modules.description: Takes any LineString or Polygon and returns the overlapping lines between both features.

returns.desc: lines(s) that are overlapping between both features

modules.name: lineSegment
modules.description: Creates a FeatureCollection of 2-vertex LineString segments from a (Multi)LineString or (Multi)Polygon.

modules.name: lineSliceAlong
modules.description: Takes a line , a specified distance along the line to a start Point , and a specified distance along the line to a stop point and returns a subsection of the line in-between those points.

params.Description: distance along the line to starting point
distance along the line to ending point
can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

modules.name: lineSlice
modules.description: Takes a line , a start Point , and a stop point and returns a subsection of the line in-between those points. The start & stop points don't need to fall exactly on the line.

modules.name: lineSplit
modules.description: Split a LineString by another GeoJSON Feature.

modules.name: lineStringToPolygon
modules.description: Converts (Multi)LineString(s) to Polygon(s).

params.Description: auto complete linestrings (matches first & last coordinates)
sorts linestrings to place outer ring at the first position of the coordinates

modules.name: mask
modules.description: Takes any type of polygon and an optional mask and returns a polygon exterior ring with holes.

params.Description: GeoJSON Polygon used as interior rings or holes.
GeoJSON Polygon used as the exterior ring (if undefined, the world extent is used)

modules.name: coordEachCallback
modules.description: Callback for coordEach

params.Description:
The index of the current element being processed in the
array.Starts at index 0, if an initialValue is provided, and at index 1 otherwise.

modules.name: midpoint
modules.description: Takes two points and returns a point midway between them. The midpoint is calculated geodesically, meaning the curvature of the earth is taken into account.

returns.desc: a point midway between  pt1  and  pt2

modules.name: nearest
modules.description: Takes a reference point and a FeatureCollection of Features with Point geometries and returns the point from the FeatureCollection closest to the reference. This calculation is geodesic.

returns.desc: the closest point in the set to the reference point

modules.name: planepoint
modules.description: Takes a triangular plane as a Polygon and a Point within that triangle and returns the z-value at that point. The Polygon should have properties a , b , and c that define the values at its three corners. Alternatively, the z-values of each triangle point can be provided by their respective 3rd coordinate if their values are not provided as properties.

params.Description: the Point for which a z-value will be calculated
a Polygon feature with three vertices

modules.name: pointGrid
modules.description: Creates a Point grid from a bounding box, FeatureCollection or Feature.

params.Description: extent in  minX, minY, maxX, maxY  order
used in calculating cellSide, can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers
adjust points position to center the grid into bbox.  This parameter is going to be removed  in the next major release, having the output always centered into bbox.

if true, and bbox is a Polygon or MultiPolygon, the grid Point will be created
only if inside the bbox Polygon(s)

modules.name: pointOnLine
modules.description: Takes a Point and a LineString and calculates the closest Point on the (Multi)LineString.

returns.desc: closest point on the  line  to  point. The properties object will contain three values:  index : closest point was found on nth line part,  dist : distance between pt and the closest point,  location : distance along the line between start and the closest point.

params.Description: can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

modules.name: pointOnSurface
modules.description: Takes a feature and returns a Point guaranteed to be on the surface of the feature.

returns.desc: a point on the surface of  input

params.Description: any feature or set of features

modules.name: polygonTangents
modules.description: Finds the tangents of a (Multi)Polygon from a Point.

returns.desc: Feature Collection containing the two tangent points

params.Description: to calculate the tangent points from

modules.name: polygonToLineString
modules.description: Converts a Polygon to (Multi)LineString or MultiPolygon to a FeatureCollection of (Multi)LineString.

modules.name: polygonize
modules.description: Polygonizes (Multi)LineString(s) into Polygons.

modules.name: random
modules.description: Generates random GeoJSON data, including Points and Polygons , for testing and experimentation.

params.Description: how many geometries should be generated.
options relevant to the feature desired. Can include:

modules.name: rewind
modules.description: Rewind (Multi)LineString or (Multi)Polygon outer ring counterclockwise and inner rings clockwise (Uses Shoelace Formula ).

params.Description: allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)

modules.name: rhumbBearing
modules.description: Takes two points and finds the bearing angle between them along a Rhumb line i.e. the angle measured in degrees start the north line (0 degrees)

returns.desc: bearing from north in decimal degrees, between -180 and 180 degrees (positive clockwise)

params.Description: calculates the final bearing if true

modules.name: rhumbDestination
modules.description: Returns the destination Point having travelled the given distance along a Rhumb line from the origin Point with the (constant) given bearing.

params.Description: constant bearing angle ranging from -180 to 180 degrees from north

modules.name: rhumbDistance
modules.description: Calculates the distance along a rhumb line between two points in degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers.

params.Description: can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

modules.name: sample
modules.description: Takes a FeatureCollection and returns a FeatureCollection with given number of features at random.

modules.name: sector
modules.description: Creates a circular sector of a circle of given radius and center Point , between (clockwise) bearing1 and bearing2; 0 bearing is North of center point, positive clockwise.

params.Description: angle, in decimal degrees, of the first radius of the sector
angle, in decimal degrees, of the second radius of the sector

modules.name: simplify
modules.description: Takes a LineString or Polygon and returns a simplified version. Internally uses simplify-js to perform simplification.

params.Description:
whether or not to spend more time to create
a higher-quality simplification with a different algorithm

modules.name: squareGrid
modules.description: Creates a square grid from a bounding box, Feature or FeatureCollection.

params.Description: extent in  minX, minY, maxX, maxY  order
used in calculating cellSize, can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers
adjust width & height cellSize to fit exactly within bbox

modules.name: square
modules.description:
Takes a bounding box and calculates the minimum square bounding box that
would contain the input.

params.Description: extent in  west, south, east, north  order

modules.name: tag
modules.description: Takes a set of points and a set of polygons and performs a spatial join.

returns.desc: points with  containingPolyId  property containing values from  polyId

params.Description: property in  polygons  to add to joined { <Point> } features
property in  points  in which to store joined property from  polygons

modules.name: tesselate
modules.description: Tesselates a Feature into a FeatureCollection of triangles using earcut.

modules.name: tin
modules.description: Takes a set of points and creates a Triangulated Irregular Network , or a TIN for short, returned as a collection of Polygons. These are often used for developing elevation contour maps or stepped heat visualizations.

params.Description:
name of the property from which to pull z values
This is optional: if not given, then there will be no extra data added to the derived triangles.

modules.name: transformRotate
modules.description: Rotates any geojson Feature or Geometry of a specified angle, around its centroid or a given pivot point; all rotations follow the right-hand rule: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Right-hand_rule

params.Description: of rotation (along the vertical axis), from North in decimal degrees, negative clockwise
point around which the rotation will be performed
allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)

modules.name: transformTranslate
modules.description:
Moves any geojson Feature or Geometry of a specified distance along a Rhumb Line
on the provided direction angle.

params.Description: length of the motion; negative values determine motion in opposite direction
of the motion; angle from North in decimal degrees, positive clockwise
in which  distance  will be express; miles, kilometers, degrees, or radians
length of the vertical motion, same unit of distance
allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)

modules.name: transformScale
modules.description:
Scale a GeoJSON from a given point by a factor of scaling (ex: factor=2 would make the GeoJSON 200% larger).
If a FeatureCollection is provided, the origin point will be calculated based on each individual Feature.

params.Description: of scaling, positive or negative values greater than 0
Point from which the scaling will occur (string options: sw/se/nw/ne/center/centroid)
allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)

modules.name: triangleGrid
modules.description: Takes a bounding box and a cell depth and returns a set of triangular polygons in a grid.

params.Description: extent in  minX, minY, maxX, maxY  order
used in calculating cellSize, can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

modules.name: truncate
modules.description: Takes a GeoJSON Feature or FeatureCollection and truncates the precision of the geometry.

params.Description: any GeoJSON Feature, FeatureCollection, Geometry or GeometryCollection.
maximum number of coordinates (primarly used to remove z coordinates)
allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)

modules.name: union
modules.description: Takes two or more polygons and returns a combined polygon. If the input polygons are not contiguous, this function returns a MultiPolygon feature.

returns.desc: a combined  Polygon  or  MultiPolygon  feature

modules.name: unkinkPolygon
modules.description: Takes a kinked polygon and returns a feature collection of polygons that have no kinks. Uses simplepolygon internally.

modules.name: within
modules.description: Takes a set of points and a set of polygons and returns the points that fall within the polygons.

returns.desc: points that land within at least one polygon
